thread.title: Mets create slip 'n' slide made of beer as they celebrate NLDS clincher - Fox News
thread.title_full: Mets create slip 'n' slide made of beer as they celebrate NLDS clincher - Fox News

title: Mets create slip 'n' slide made of beer as they celebrate NLDS clincher - Fox News
text:
Mets create slip 'n' slide made of beer as they celebrate NLDS clincher Published October 16, 2015 Facebook 0 Twitter 0 Email Print LOS ANGELES, CA - OCTOBER 15: The New York Mets celebrate in the locker room after the Mets 3-2 victory against the Los Angeles Dodgers in game five of the National League Division Series at Dodger Stadium on October 15, 2015 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Harry How/Getty Images) The Mets celebrate clinching the NLDS after defeating the Dodgers, 3-2, at Dodger Stadium on Thursday. Harry How Getty Images 
After winning a tough NLDS series against the Dodgers, the Mets went all-out in their postgame celebration. 
With a clutch performance by second baseman Daniel Murphy that will be talked about for ages by Mets fans, New York advanced to the NLCS with a 3-2 win over the Dodgers in Los Angeles on Thursday. More from FoxSports Mattingly answers tough questions following the Dodgers' first round exit 
After closer Jeurys Familia notched the final out of a rare six-out save, the Mets all flocked around the mound and reveled in the victory, which will send them to the National League Championship Series for the first time since 2006. These celebrations never get old. #LGM pic.twitter.com/36R5lm7F60 -- New York Mets (@Mets) October 16, 2015 
They later participated in the traditional champagne spraying in the visitors' clubhouse at Dodger Stadium, but there were a few unique touches to their celebration. — New York Mets (@Mets) October 16, 2015 
Shortly after the Mets celebrated amongst themselves on the field, manager Terry Collins ran along the left-field line to celebrate with fans, and was greeted with a passionate smooch on the cheek from an elated fan. Best GIF ever. We <3 Terry. #LGM pic.twitter.com/VaeQ2JFaIj — New York Mets (@Mets) October 16, 2015 
After the night's saviors, Murphy and Familia, got their proper beer dousing, the Mets decided to have some fun with the buckets full of beer they had on hand. — New York Mets (@Mets) October 16, 2015 
In a resourceful and imaginative twist, the Mets poured beer on the protective plastic sheeting on the floor and turned the clubhouse into a slip 'n' slide. 
Watch the video below as pitcher Jonathon Niese gives it a whirl. — New York Mets (@Mets) October 16, 2015 
The Mets will host the Cubs on Saturday in Game 1 of the NLCS. Advertisement
